programme.desc: Lee Mack's not having much luck with lights these days, whether it's the fizzling sign at the start of this show, the blackout during his recent Sheffield gig, or the dimly lit area at the start of this seventh series. Lee and Lucy have enjoyed a spot of culture at their local cinema, but the sparkle of a French movie is soon diminished when the romantic walk home finds them in an imposing underpass. She has her handbag stolen by a bunch of cocky youths from under his nose. Given the fact the layabout failed to protect her, or come up with an accurate description of their muggers, Lee feels the urge to prove his manliness, but will a spell at the local boxing ring be a help or a hindrance? programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The sabotaging efforts of Peugeot in Nazi-occupied France, where the bosses and workers cooperated closely with the Resistance to hinder the use of military vehicles by the Nazis.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey describes how Winston Churchill drew on the lessons of his ancestor John to lead the UK through the Second World War. At two key moments, the prime minister's strategic sense helped avert disaster, and in both decisions, the influence of the Duke of Marlborough is apparent. Starkey argues that it was Winston's ability to control events by giving them a narrative meaning that enabled him to shape world history long after his fall from power.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: Documentary about the Holocaust and some of the key figures involved, beginning with Hjalmar Schacht, who was never a Nazi but played a vital role in Hitler's plans.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: The story of the Ahnenerbe research institute, which was set up to provide scientific backing to Hitler's ideology, through a series of horrific experiments.

programme.title: Forbidden History

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The hunt for Gestapo head Klaus Barbie and death camp guard John Demjanjuk, dubbed 'The Butcher of Lyon' and 'Ivan the Terrible' respectively, which lasted into the 1980s.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit the Royal William Yard in Plymouth, where they are given the chance to cast their eyes over a number of potentially valuable items. On the waterfront, militaria expert Graham Lay has doubts about a pair of doorknobs thought to have belonged to Admiral Horatio Nelson. The team is impressed by a chess set made from parts of the aircraft carrier HMS Ark Royal, and a psychedelic painting of a band that performed at Woodstock intrigues Clive Stewart-Lockhart. Plus, jewellery specialist John Benjamin marvels at a diamond necklace the length of a skipping rope, donated to the city of Plymouth by Lady Astor.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Engineering breakthroughs that allow trains to go faster than ever, including technology that allows the navigation of the winding mountains of Spain at speed..

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ruined compound on the edge of a peninsula in Colombia which was once home to a famous outlaw and the strange towers looming over red-tinted waters in a Portuguese landscape.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents from Plymouth's Royal William Yard. Items brought in to be valued include a ceremonial wooden spoon presented to the student who got the worst exam results in the history of Cambridge University, one of the last flasks of naval rum to be produced, a book of designs by a famous landscape gardener, a ceremonial hammer and chisel and some dolls' house furniture. One visitor discovers the brooch she bought in a charity shop is much older than she thought.

programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth
programme.desc: Documentary examining the animals pitting themselves against the world's wildest ocean, unveiling the natural forces that underpin life in the Atlantic. In the vast South Atlantic, huge pods of dolphins, massive penguin colonies and the largest gathering of marine mammals on Earth pack chains of extraordinary islands, created by powerful volcanic forces far below them. Meanwhile, the nutrient-rich upwellings create profusions of life in some areas, and the abyssal depths host a world of bizarre creatures in others.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough swims alongside sea otters, discovering he is no match for their natural agility in the water, while in Florida he takes a dip with manatees for the first time and observes their feeding habits. On the coast of California, he encounters the largest mammals on the planet, blue whales, and reveals how they, along with porpoises and dolphins, learned to court, mate and give birth in the water.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants.

programme.title: The Blue Planet

programme.title: Coast

programme.title: The Coroner

programme.title: New Tricks

programme.desc: The sleuthing housewife investigates a spiritualist who appears to be blackmailing her customers, while Geoffrey falls in love, but his secret romance threatens to undermine Hetty's carefully laid trap - and nearly causes him to quit the agency.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Vic Snow makes a new friend, while Ruth's baby son Alfie is snatched by one of the residents at a local nursing home and taken on a bizarre trek over freezing-cold Skelthwaite Moors - in the general direction of the local reservoir. Popular drama, starring Sarah Lancashire, Pam Ferris, Tony Haygarth and Thomas Craig.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The antiques dealer attempts to sell dodgy prints to a friend of Lady Jane Felsham - only to learn Eric has procured a bronze statue in a house on a pig farm famously stolen from Her Majesty the Queen. Drama, starring Ian McShane, Dudley Sutton and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.sub-title: Who Is the Fairest of Them All?
programme.desc: The antiques dealer is asked to sell a sinister-looking mirror from a ballet school, and determines to finally marry Lady Jane. Roger Lloyd Pack (Trigger in Only Fools and Horses) guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Richard Sharpe and the faithful Harper begin their latest tour of duty by uncovering top-level corruption in the Army. Guest starring Julian Fellowes and featuring Alexander Armstrong in an early role.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Dennis's first task as gaffer is to pick up a valuable antique bath from Fidel Castro's country residence and bring it back to Havana as a gift to the ambassador. Despite having made other plans for their day off, the lads reluctantly agree to join him, and a bite to eat at the Cuban leader's expense helps to lift their spirits - but Barry, Oz and Neville disappear en route. Tim Healy, Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet

Wyman takes a leaf out of his late father's book by seducing embassy worker Tina. Meanwhile, Neville's loyalties are tested when he is ordered to spy on a Manchester United fan, and Dennis begins to feel left out. Jimmy Nail, Tim Healy and Kevin Whately star.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are hired to create a garden as a wedding present, and find a baby under a gooseberry bush. The discovery brings out Rosemary's maternal side as the pair investigate who abandoned the child. Their task is complicated by the murder of an artistic neighbour - and the two mysterious incidents appear to be connected. Starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo visit a resort in Spain to create a trophy garden for a pro-am tennis tournament run by a former champion. While investigating, Laura enters the mysterious world of bullfighting, and Rosemary rediscovers her love of motor scooters.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The green-fingered amateur detectives work on a garden for an open-air theatre, where Rosemary's cousin is due to perform. However, the production suffers a setback when an actor shoots himself during rehearsal - and the gun is found to have contained live bullets instead of blanks. A member of the cast gets an attack of stage fright, and Laura is obliged to take her place in the play as the duo try to find the culprit. Drama, with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: An avid cyclist suffers a massive coronary at the top of a local mountain, but with astronomical levels of caffeine in his system, there is more to his death than meets the eye.

programme.desc: After three months back in 2010, Alex is desperate to return to the 1980s, where Gene is on the run accused of trying to kill her, and the team is in disarray with Ray promoted to DI and a child's kidnapping to investigate. programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: A serial killer targets women signed up to a dating agency, so Alex puts aside her examination of Sam Tyler's death back in Manchester to go undercover. Fantasy crime drama, starring Keeley Hawes and Monserrat Lombard, with Beth Goddard.

programme.desc: A reluctant Brian enters an addiction centre run by monks to treat his alcoholism, but soon becomes bored and looks for a distraction. Richard Wilson and Fay Ripley guest star.

programme.desc: Drama based on the last days of cult leader David Koresh, and the 51-day siege between February and April 1993 at a compound belonging to his religious sect. In the first episode, the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, and Firearms (ATF) receives a tip-off of suspicious activity involving weapons taking place among a small religious community led by David Koresh at the Mount Carmel Center, located just outside of Waco, Texas. Starring Taylor Kitsch, Michael Shannon, Melissa Benoist and John Leguizamo.

programme.title: Waco
programme.desc: ATF agent Jacob Vasquez begins undercover surveillance on the Mount Carmel compound and befriends David Koresh in hope of finding illegal weapons or other activity.

programme.title: Waco
programme.desc: With the ATF siege in motion, assault vehicles storm the Mount Carmel compound and exchange gunfire, which begins a 51-day stand-off.

programme.desc: David Kent returns home unexpectedly and catches wife-to-be Sheelagh going through his belongings. programme.desc: Eleanor comes up against the governors of the East London Hospital when they threaten to take over the Thrift. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.desc: Fern Britton hosts another culinary showdown, judged this week by Rosemary Shrager, who begins by demonstrating how to peel, cut and slice pears into fans, before giving the contestants five minutes to copy what she has just done. Six hopefuls go through to the next stage where they have to French trim pork chops, before the final three use the meat to create the best pork dish they can.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jamie and Andrea return, Moira is stung by Cain, and Mandy wants Paul to go.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: David is chased by an angry mob and cornered in an alleyway, while the doctor warns Leanne that it is too soon to be sure, but Oliver may have suffered brain damage. Tommy Orpington assures James he did the right thing coming out, and Chesney urges Gemma to share her vlog online.

programme.title: Absolutely India: Mancs in Mumbai
programme.desc: Manchester-born brothers Ryan, Adam and Scott Thomas embark on an epic journey to trace their family roots in India, joined by their dad Dougie, whose father was born in Mumbai. However, the trio have never visited the country they descended from. In the fifth episode, Adam attempts to master an ancient sport when he and Scott get a taste of Indian parklife. Elsewhere, Ryan and Dougie make a shock discovery about Dougie's grandmother, before the group join in with the festivities for the country's biggest party for Diwali.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul helps to feed a pair of week-old kittens whose mother has abandoned them. However, as the kittens grow older, the team discover that one of them has a neurological problem affecting his movement. Later, Paul meets a group of dogs from a puppy farm who have had very little human interaction in the past, and need help learning how to socialise.

programme.title: Little Boy Blue
programme.desc: Mercer and his associates are tried for their roles in the killing of 11-year-old Rhys Jones, but the verdict fails to bring closure for the boy's parents Melanie and Steve as the fractures in their relationship come to a head. Meanwhile an unexpected setback leaves Det Supt Dave Kelly with a tough decision to make. The concluding part of the fact-based drama centred on the devastating impact of a child's murder amid a wave of gang violence in Liverpool, starring Stephen Graham, Sinead Keenan and Bran F O'Byrne.

Tonight, a man is accidentally tasered, a couple set their kitchen on fire, and a toddler in an electric car runs amok in a shopping centre.

programme.title: Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family?
programme.desc: Anne 'The Governess' Hegerty presents as eight celebrity families take part in the knockout tournament, hoping to win 25,000 for their chosen charity and the coveted title of Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family. The first episode is a battle of the soaps, as Coronation Street's Lucy Fallon (Bethany Platt) and her family take on former EastEnders star Shaun Williamson (Barry Evans) and his clan. Two new rounds have been added to this celebrity spin on the format - including an Observation round featuring cartoon images of Anne that put their memories to the test.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Scammers: Hunting the Lockdown Criminals - Tonight
programme.desc: There has been a spike in internet fraud - from fake goods and services to con artists impersonating the authorities through emails, texts, calls and even appearing at people's front doors. Paul Connolly investigates the unscrupulous crooks using the lockdown to prey on others.

programme.title: Police Tapes
programme.sub-title: The Murder of Rhys Jones: Police Tapes
programme.desc: When 11-year-old Rhys Jones was shot dead on his way home from weekly football practice in 2007, his family was left shattered and police were left with a case that seemed impenetrable. But when certain names were mentioned again and again, the police planted secret bugs in the homes of these gang members. Here, Susanna Reid gains unprecedented access to the subsequent recordings, where those responsible admit their part and the lengths they would go to cover up the crime. She also talks to Rhys's parents, Mel and Steve, about the impact of this appalling crime.

programme.desc: Andrea knows Jamie is lying, Moira takes out her annoyance on poor Priya, Wendy wants another chance with Bob, and Manpreet has a plan.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Shona visits Gail and Sarah, but is clearly confused, while Alya visits Yasmeen in prison and assures her that she knows Geoff abused her, but Yasmeen refuses to discuss it. The doctor tells Leanne that Oliver's test results won't be back for a few weeks and he's free to go home, but while Leanne's delighted, convinced he's improving, Steve and Nick mask their concern.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: A couple of the birds are forced to fly this week when one of them becomes fed up of being treated like a doormat. It seems Tracey has had enough of visits from Dorien's gentleman callers to her home, and is equally unhappy that her sister doesn't contribute to the household finances, so she throws them both out. The pair of them are soon holed up together in Sharon's old bedsit, where they decide to take a united stand - but things are never quite that straightforward. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective is brought in to investigate when a former Met police officer is stabbed to death outside a nightclub in Newcastle. The team initially suspects a crime of passion after it emerges the victim had recently rekindled his affair with his childhood sweetheart, whose husband has a history of violence. However, Vera uncovers evidence pointing to a more complex case involving inside information and the hostile takeover of a brewery. What did the deceased find out that cost him his life? Guest starring Jill Halfpenny, Christine Bottomley, Ralph Ineson and Liam Cunningham.

programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies (2014)
programme.desc: Dwarf king Thorin reclaims control of his homeland, but his descent into madness places him on the brink of war with his human and elven allies. As Thorin's Hobbit friend Bilbo tries to save the tormented ruler from himself, a vast horde of orcs gathers to destroy them all. Conclusion of the fantasy adventure trilogy, starring Martin Freeman, Richard Armitage, Ian McKellen, Luke Evans and Orlando Bloom.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: The raccoons break into the Mikkelsens' and Mercury stumbles upon a didgeridoo and just can't get enough of it. Can Mike shut them up?.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean looks back over his life, recalling how he acquired his beloved teddy bear and learned to drive. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: A mysterious furry pink animal moves in with Bean, who doesn't know what it is but can't bring himself to get rid of such an odd creature.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Get ready for awesome action adventures with Rath! Taking out villains is all part of the fun for this hero. His mission - to save the day!.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Sickening Fumes of Smartsy Fartsy
programme.desc: The boys create a smart gas cloud to steal Mr Krupp's rulebook, but it turns against them..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Betty wants a nice photo of Dave and Anna, but the camera George uses happens to belong to Gran, and it's been cursed by an ancient mummy..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: If there were two things Dave could wish for it would be for Fuzzypeg to smell better, and for Gran to be nicer. Is getting what you want always a good thing?.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James presents more highlights from the series, as well as preparing prawn biryani, French onion soup, and fig gateau, and providing a masterclass on steamed sponge pudding. Plus, James' culinary tour of Cornwall and recipes from chefs Clare Smyth, Atul Kochhar and Richard Bertinet.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by Clare Smyth for a tour of the Lake District. They visit the Windermere Jetty Museum and take a trip on the lake in a traditional steam-powered boat. They also visit the farmers who supply the meat for Clare's restaurant and discover the secrets behind the region's famous sticky toffee pudding.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott is still in the eastern Mediterranean country of Jordan. In the seaside city of Aqaba he uses local molasses in a fattoush salad, and cooks with the chefs at a swanky golf club, where roasted fish with spicy rice is the order of the day. Ainsley also visits the city of Petra, learning the history of the Bedouin people and exploring the astonishing Treasury building. Back in his kitchen, chicken shawarma with tahini sauce and pitta bread packed with spiced beef mince are the final dishes on the menu.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and his team are in Doncaster, where Stewart Hofgartner assesses a vintage camera and Fay Rutter hopes to pocket a handsome timepiece.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five university friends answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Warwick Davis hosts.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.sub-title: 2018 World Cup: England v Colombia - ITV Football Classics
programme.desc: Gabriel Clarke introduces a look back at the memorable last-16 tie at Otkritie Arena, Moscow, which was decided by a penalty shootout. Original coverage presented by Mark Pougatch, with analysis from Ian Wright, Lee Dixon and Gary Neville, and commentary by Clive Tyldesley and Glenn Hoddle.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara host the grand final of the obstacle course challenge, with the final five competitors from across the nation testing their strength, speed and courage. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win 250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, and each of them has the chance to put their favourite contestant straight through to the live semi-finals by awarding them the Golden Buzzer.

programme.title: Alan Carr's Epic Gameshow
programme.desc: The comedian takes a trip down memory lane as he presents a series of classic TV game shows, which have all been updated with a new final round offering the contestants a chance to win big. The next four weeks will see Alan in charge of The Price Is Right, Take Your Pick, Strike it Lucky and Bullseye. But tonight he steps into the shoes of much-missed funnyman Bruce Forsyth for Play Your Cards Right, which sees four celebrity couples taking a chance on the turn of a single card. The hopefuls are daytime stalwarts Ruth Langsford and Eamonn Holmes, comedian Chris Ramsey and his wife Rosie, presenter Ore Oduba and his wife Portia, and singer-actress Martine McCutcheon and her husband Jack McManus.

programme.title: Captain America: Civil War (2016)
programme.desc: The superhuman soldier is propelled into conflict with his Avengers teammate Iron Man over a system of government control over their actions - a situation made worse when an old friend is accused of being behind a terror attack. As a cunning conspiracy surrounds them all, Captain America finds himself battling former allies, vengeful enemies, and new heroes on the block Black Panther and Spider-Man. Superhero adventure, starring Chris Evans, Robert Downey Jr and Scarlett Johansson.

programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis, with five thirtysomethings from London answering questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge. They then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Andrea struggles seeing Jamie and Belle together, but hatches a plan to tear them apart, and uses the quiz night at the Woolpack to make their affair a very public matter. Rhona and Moira clash during a client meeting, while Rishi hides his alarm when he reads what appears to be a love letter from Wendy addressed to him.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Geoff gains entry to Number 6 to delete the CCTV footage, Roy finds Shona lurking outside the caf, and Dev decides to move the twins to Oakhill School.

programme.title: Coronavirus: Q&A
programme.desc: Nina Hossain puts viewers' questions on a range of subjects relating to the Covid-19 outbreak to a panel of expert guests.

programme.title: Grow Your Own at Home with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan shows how to grow a summer feast of strawberries, even if the only space available is a doorstep, and family-friendly ways to grow delicious vegetables. His Love Your Garden team members Katie Rushworth, Frances Tophill and David Domoney join in from their homes with clever hacks and tips to get viewers making the most out of their gardens, window boxes or windowsills.

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present the stories of people who were abandoned as babies, helping them try to find their birth families and know their identities. David McBride was left in a car as a two-week-old infant in January 1962, while Helen Ward was left in a tartan bag in a telephone box in Dundalk in 1968.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Les Dawson Forever
programme.desc: The first of two programmes celebrating the career of the Manchester-born comedy star. Les's youngest daughter Charlotte Dawson meets Opportunity Knocks director Royston Mayoh to hear how an audition would change her father's life for ever, Les's comedy partner Roy Barraclough reminisces about their famous characters Cissie and Ada, and Barry Cryer returns to Yorkshire Television to revisit some of Les's friends.

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.sub-title: 2018 World Cup: England v Colombia - ITV Football Classics
programme.desc: Gabriel Clarke introduces a look back at the memorable last-16 tie at Otkritie Arena, Moscow, which was decided by a penalty shootout. Original coverage presented by Mark Pougatch, with analysis from Ian Wright, Lee Dixon and Gary Neville, and commentary by Clive Tyldesley and Glenn Hoddle.

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: The final three contenders have just two minutes to select from the larder containing a stunning array of fresh fruit and vegetables, pulses and grains, condiments and sauce ingredients to work in conjunction with crab meat. They then have 25 minutes to concoct a sumptuous meal. With a trio of Mediterranean-ispired crab dishes on the menu, judge Rosemary Shrager faces a mouth-watering feast before she must make the ultimate decision, upon which rests a 1,000 cash prize. Presented by Fern Britton.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: In the final episode of the ninth series, Martin rushes to Ruth's for a medical emergency, and preparations for Morwenna and Al's wedding do not go to plan. Elsewhere, Martin takes his final GMC assessment under the watchful eye of eminent surgeon Bernard Newton, who monitors Martin's skills in assisted surgery. Starring Martin Clunes, Tom Conti, Caroline Catz and Jessica Ransom.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts the quiz, with six more contestants competing in Fastest Finger First to see who will sit in the hot seat and have the chance to take home the 1million jackpot. To make things easier, the players have four lifelines - Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend, 50:50 and Ask the Host - at their disposal.

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell help two more people who were found as babies after being abandoned to track down their birth families. Simon Jeffery was left in a box outside a railway tavern in Greenhithe, a story which hit the headlines but which he only learned about by chance at the age of 10. Fi Beazer was discovered in a public toilet in Warminster when she was only a few hours old. Both have spent their adult life trying to track down their parents, and submit DNA samples in the hope of finally getting the answers they seek.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Les Dawson Forever
programme.desc: Part two of two. Members of the dance troupe the Roly Polys reunite on stage to reminisce about working alongside Les and Les's wife Tracy Dawson reunites with karaoke superfan Penny Morgan, who was given the opportunity to perform the duet of a lifetime on Cilla Black's Surprise Surprise in 1993.

programme.title: Absolutely India: Mancs in Mumbai
programme.desc: Manchester-born brothers Ryan, Adam and Scott Thomas embark on an epic journey to trace their family roots in India, joined by their dad Dougie, whose father was born in Mumbai. However, the trio have never visited the country they descended from. In the fifth episode, Adam attempts to master an ancient sport when he and Scott get a taste of Indian parklife. Elsewhere, Ryan and Dougie make a shock discovery about Dougie's grandmother, before the group join in with the festivities for the country's biggest party for Diwali.

Fern Britton hosts.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China try to breathe new life into an old VW Beetle.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. The VW Beetle begins to take shape as auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and expert mechanic Edd China continue their restoration, but things do not go according to plan.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Military equipment collector Bruce Crompton visits Germany, where he discovers a nuclear core from a secret Nazi weapon-testing factory.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Paul Jr and Paul Sr have a meeting away from the cameras to discuss their relationship, while OCC finishes a bike for MyPillow and PJD begins a build for a baseball player.

programme.title: Aircraft Stories
programme.desc: Documentary examining Russia's massive bomber planes, including the Bear, Bison and Badger, which kept Nato on alert during the Cold War.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe heads to Windsorland Mobile Home Park, where he finds the production of mannequins is not only dirty but also difficult.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The crew visits the birthplace of the Koenigsegg One:1, revealing its inner workings and impressive exterior.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: How a BMW i8 is made, featuring a trip to its birthplace.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How ancient Greeks invented parchment with techniques still used today. Plus, the making of shuttlecocks.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove continue their hunt through Britain's sheds, searching for nice little earners to buy, restore and flog for a tidy profit. In Somerset they discover Norton motorbikes, Italian mopeds and French go-karts.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove move on to Hertfordshire, where they find vintage cars, obscure tractors and rare British bikes from the 1950s. It's all going well, but when the haggling starts, things don't turn out quite how anyone expected.
